name: Herald Square Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent location.The hotel have everything that we wanted.
reviews.title: I recomend

reviews.text: I stayed at the Herald for 6 nights in a single room ... and have to say I was pleased overall.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay!
Good Value
reviews.text: Clean, quiet, Comfy bed, free HBO, free coffee in the basement, excellent central location, fairly priced; you can't go really wrong!

However there clearly was a problem with my smoke alarm, which went off several times during my first time... and i was told to "just leave my window open", "you don't want to wake up with your room full of smoke", and yes that sounds kinda scary. Plus I had to get dressed to go to reception to fet someone to fix that up...
reviews.title: Great price & location

likes.liked: — Location! Location! Location! and the rate
likes.disliked: — Check-in area was behind glassed, secure area

reviews.text: This wasn't very professional.
reviews.title: Super Clean! Super Value! Super Location

reviews.text: We've traveled with another couple to NY several times and stayed at Herald Square twice. We booked the remodeled rooms and would highly recommend! Their reception staff was good the first time but has improved since our last visit - more professional. Monica was extremely helpful, polite and accommodating! A gentleman working on the morning we left was also just as nice and helpful! He recommended a great Italian place around the corner, Bella Napoli - we loved it, great NY charm and very reasonable. Our rooms were very clean and the beds are AMAZINGLY comfortable! I've never slept in a more comfortable bed, other than my own. This hotel is going to great lengths to be a great hotel and they are succeeding. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends and co-workers. It's hard to beat the price or the location, unless you want to be right in Times Square. It's a short walk to wherever you want to go and walking is much faster than a cab. :)
reviews.title: Second stay even better than the first!!!

likes.liked: — The beds, the location & the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband & I stayed here from Friday, 2nd November for 3 nights.
reviews.title: A Basic Hotel, Centrally Located.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first time to New York so I had booked it upon a recommendation by some colleagues. They had told me that this hotel was very basic but that the location was excellent because a lot of places were within walking distance and more importantly that it's not as expensive as other hotels. I did compare the prices to some other options I looked at on the web and it certainly seemed to be the case, unless of course you managed to get a "special" or one didn’t mind some of the tacky places that were on offer. Therefore, on these grounds we decided to try out the Herald Square Hotel.
reviews.title: What a wonderful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would now entirely agree with what we had been told in advance; the Hotel is rather old fashioned, nothing glamorous about it. Our room was very basic, very small but clean and it looked out onto a wall and fire escape (no room with a view here!! ). There was some sort of fan or air con system at our window blowing in cold air on the first night, although there was an adequte amount of bed clothes on the bed so we were still warm but standing or walking about in the room it felt cold. We told the receptionist the next day and I think the heating was turned on as it seemed better. During our 3 nights stay, there wasn't really any noise, apart from the air con in the room, so we were grateful for this.
reviews.title: Scarred for life on dodgey beds!

likes.disliked: — Lack of natural light and the cost!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In conclusion, we would recommend this hotel if you are just looking to be centrally located in a basic (with TV), clean, very small room without any fancy trimmings at a reasonally priced rate. When I say "reasonably pricedt", well this is New York we're talking about, so the prices are above and beyond what we'd normally expect to pay. I think it's suitable for visiting tourists who will be on the move throughout most of the day and just want to use their room as a base; somewhere to sleep after a day's shopping and doing all the tourist sites. Just be prepared it's not the Hilton by no stretch of the imagination, that's for sure. :)
reviews.title: the truth about the rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at Herald Square Hotel last September (8 nights).
reviews.title: family from Croatia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That was our second time in New York City. First time we stayed at Herald Square Hotel, too. What to say - excellent!
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'll be back!
reviews.title: honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just got back from visiting New York New York, and we found this hotel to be in a fantastic position as it is right near the Empire State Building, which is approx about half way mark of Manhatten Island, the hotel was very clean, the beds were very comfortable and great pillows, our room was big enough as was the bathroom, if your in New York, your not in the room much anyway as there is to much to do and see. We didn't explore the Hotel to much as we were hardly there anyway, and buy the time we got back to the Hotel, we were really in need of that fantastic comfy bed. I would recommended this hotel if you are doing the site seeing bit in the big apple, all the important aspects of the hotel were ther eeg: good
reviews.title: Loved the Herald

likes.liked: — Location and great Value for money

reviews.text: bed and hot water for the much needed shower.
reviews.title: Excellent location and good value

likes.disliked: — Its a little tired in appearance

reviews.text: First, I was a little unsure about this place because it was in a great location but was only $99 a night. That's unheard of for NYC. Also, the website was kinda sketchy and well, interesting. The hotel is 2 blocks from the Empire State building, and so close to everything like shops and subway stops.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

reviews.text: The room itself was kind of small but the bathrooms were rather large and the bed was SO comfy! My room had a little tv in it but my sisters had a very nice flat screen. The desk staff was very nice and gave us lockers to store our stuff early.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: Parking was only $21 for overnight (also unheard of), just make sure you get your ticket stamped by the hotel. Otherwise it would be $50- $60.
reviews.title: All I can say is WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will definitely stay here in the future!
reviews.title: What a great find!

reviews.text: Stayed 21 - 25th Aug 07. We had a renovated room on the 9th floor which was great 2 x big and really comfy beds, nice bathroom with powerful shower , flatscreen TV, could not fault the room for the price we paid.
reviews.title: a great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed in the Herald Square Hotel for 2 nites in december as part of a shopping trip to New York/Boston.
reviews.title: Unexpected Gem for a budget class hotel
Fantastic Value
reviews.text: We were a little apprehenisive based on some previous reviews, and yes the hotel doesn't look much from the outside, and the foyer is tiny, and the lift looks dodgy! But its the lovely room that makes all the difference..The newly renovated rooms are surprisingly spacious for NY, the bed was huge and very comfortable, there was a plasma TV, lovely bathroom, and all very clean..It had a lovely feel to it overall. The location (31st) was also perfect for Macys, within walking distance.. and also within walking distance to Penn station/Madison Square Gardens, which was handy for our train up to Boston. We also found the staff to be very helpful and efficient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My advice would be; don't be put off by first impressions, this is an excellent budget hotel, ideal for shopping, but make sure to go for the newly renovated rooms.
reviews.title: Great hotel in midtown

likes.disliked: — located on a street where homeless people slept on the sidewalk a half block away

reviews.text: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Herald with my husband and 2 teenage children.
reviews.title: A real find (but don't tell everyone!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel provides fantastic value for money. It is ideally situated in Midtown , round the corner from the Empire State building and Macys.
reviews.title: Good Stay

description: Close walking distance to the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden and Macy's.Close to the Theater District, Times Square, radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center.Beautiful newly renovated rooms.Complimentary coffee machine in the lounge area.24 hours front desk and concierge service.Non Smoking throughout.Free wireless internet access.A hotel you can recommend to your clients, friends and family.
